author: Staff Reporter
text:
Cash over Rs.30 lakh was seized during various vehicle checks by flying squad here across the district. In a major seizure on Tuesday, a Bengaluru car bound to Kancheepuram was intercepted and was found carrying cash of Rs.20 lakh. The owner of the car Neelakanda Gowda, a businessman from Bengaluru, was allegedly carrying the cash in the company of his family members to Kancheepuram to purchase saris for a wedding.

Similarly, Rs.9.80 lakh was seized from a Dharmapuri-based businessman. The man had claimed to

have carried the cash to purchase land. In another seizure, Rs.1.61 lakh lacking bonafide documents was seized.

Garments seized

In another incident in Dharmapuri, flying squad here seized several bundles of garments from a jeep at Thoppur check-post on Tuesday. The load that included bundles of nighties, vests and other garments were bound to Erode.

The bundles were being carried by Kumar of Karimangalam for sales at Erode garment market, when the flying squad seized the goods that were unaccompanied by documents.
title: Seizure of cash continues
